reasoning: MTHFR polymorphism is a common genetic variant, not a disease phenotype. Heterozygous C677T polymorphism frequency ~30-35% globally; homozygous ~10%. No disease incidence applicable. Concept is fundamentally a genotype rather than a clinical disease or disorder requiring medical attention.
source: Frosst P et al. (1995). A candidate genetic risk factor for vascular disease: a common mutation in methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase. Nat Genet. 10(1):111-113
